MonsterTrait.Name: False Appearance
MonsterTrait.Text: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

MonsterTrait.Name: Grasping Tendrils
MonsterTrait.Text: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 Strength check against it.

MonsterTrait.Name: Spider Climb
MonsterTrait.Text: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

MonsterTrait.Name: Multiattack
MonsterTrait.Text: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

MonsterAction.Name: Bite
MonsterAction.Text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage.

MonsterTrait.Name: Tendril
MonsterTrait.Text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 50 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the roper canâ€™t use the same tendril on another target.

MonsterTrait.Name: Reel
MonsterTrait.Text: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.
